__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row background to a green color by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been worked on.

=== GNOME Bug reports to confirm or recreate ===
The following queries are bug reports have been reported in GNOME's bug tracker.  We might be able to help them out by trying to reproduce the bug in the development release of Ubunutu, the Gutsy Gibbon, and providing an Apport crash report or providing the needed information.

<nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.gnome.org/buglist.cgi?query=gnome-version%3A2.19%2F2.20+status%3AUNCONFIRMED+reporter%21%3Ddeveloper+severity%3Acritical|GNOME crash report bugs]]</nowiki>

<nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.gnome.org/buglist.cgi?query=gnome-version%3A2.19%2F2.20+status%3ANEEDINFO+reporter%21%3Ddeveloper+severity%3Acritical|GNOME bug reports needing more information]]</nowiki>

=== Bugs that need testing or confirmation ===
These bug reports need further testing to either confirm them or determine if a fix actually works.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Reproduce the bug report and mark it "Confirmed" '''or'''
* Confirm that the fix works, after reproducing the original bug, and mark it "Fix Released" '''or''
* Try reproducing the bug using Gutsy Gibbon and update the bug report with your findings

* Assign it to a package, improve the title and mark it "Confirmed" '''or'''
* Assign it to a package, ask a question, mark it "Incomplete" and assign it to yourself '''or'''
* Search for duplicates (and mark if found) '''or'''
* Reject it for a good reason
